NYU's New York campus is centered in two locations: the heart of New York City's famed Greenwich Village, and the School of Engineering in Downtown Brooklyn, one of the fastest growing hubs of science and technology in the nation.                                   Visiting NYU in Manhattan   Our campus visit program lasts approximately two hours, and features an admissions officer-led information session, followed by a student-led campus tour. Sessions fill up quickly, so we recommend you reserve your session in advance.   Reserve your session »    NYU Jeffrey S. Gould Welcome Center   50 West 4th Street ( Map )  New York, NY 10012  +1 212 998 4550     Welcome Center Hours: Monday-Friday 9am-5pm; Saturday 10am-4pm; Sunday 10am-4pm from April-October.   Holiday Hours: The welcome center will be closed for Presidents' Day from 4pm on Friday, February 13th until 9am on Tuesday, February 17th.                                     Visiting our Engineering School in Brooklyn   Join us in Brooklyn on most Friday afternoons for a specially-designed campus visit, featuring an admissions officer-led information session, followed by a student-led tour. The program will last approximately two hours. Please reserve your session in advance.   Reserve your session »     NYU School of Engineering Wunsch Building   311 Bridge Street ( Map )  Brooklyn, NY 11201  +1 718 637 5955     Brooklyn Welcome Center Hours: Monday-Friday 9am-5pm; Closed on Weekends   Holiday Hours: The welcome center will be closed for Presidents' Day from 4pm on Friday, February 13th until 9am on Tuesday, February 17th.               Campus Tours   NYU Campus tours last approximately one hour and are led by NYU Admissions Student Ambassadors. Our tour only options are available during the winter months and do not include an information session. Reserve your campus tour »   Self-Guided Tours   If you are unable to join us for an information session and guided tour, visit us at the NYU Welcome Center - student ambassadors are available to answer your questions and offer you a self-guided tour map of campus. Be sure to also visit our virtual tour .   Visiting an NYU class   Students are welcome to visit classes during the academic year. Classroom visits are offered Monday through Thursday during select months. Visit the Welcome Center for a list of classes that are open for visitation. (This information will be available in mid-February). Because of space limitations, classroom visits are open only to prospective students.   Group Tours   Campus tours for large groups are offered in the spring on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays at 10:30 am during the months of February and March. Select dates will be available in May. To arrange your visit, please complete the Group Tour Request Form at least three weeks in advance. Group tours will not be available on the following dates:     November 24-26, 2014   December 15, 2014 - February 2, 2015   February 17-20, 2015   March 16 - April 24, 2015   May 11-22, 2015   July and August                                            Hotel Discounts                                               Join us for a Financial Aid Info Session »                                     Learn about NYU Shanghai Join us for an NYU Shanghai Information Session in New York City. Read More                   Learn about NYU Abu Dhabi Join us for an NYU Abu Dhabi Information Session in New York City. NYU Summer        Abroad                          NYU's Summer Abroad programs offer opportunities for the course credits in Europe, Asia, South America, the Middle East, and Africa.                                                  Programs for high school students                            Take college level classes, earn credit, and experience life as an NYU student.                                    Connect with Us        Join us on Facebook , Twitter , and Instagram to connect with other prospective visiting students and stay up to date with news, announcements, and events in New York City.        2015 Program Dates     Tuesday, May 26, 2015 to Friday, August 14, 2015  Summer courses are offered in 3-, 6-, and 12-week sessions. For a breakdown by session, visit the Academic Calendar . Exact dates for each course are listed in the Albert Course Search .
